I believe Minecraft can be defined as the modern game (for better or worse) that develops potentially infinite complexity from simple premises. In a good way, obviously: complexity impresses and rewards those who seek it, but the title remains playable for anyone. At first it’s making “houses” that are 4x4 holes under the ground, but later it becomes creating titanic installations, purely aesthetic or even totally functional - let’s not forget that Minecraft, with its redstone, is Turing-complete.
